answers.answer: This is my 2nd baby and I am getting an epidural. I had a 23-24 hr labor with my 1st and got an epidural by the end of it. the epidural was great because it allowed me to get a little rest before the baby arrived. It also helped me to enjoy the birthing process with my husband better because I wasnt in pain or super cranky with him. It wasnt painful to get either, I would take that one poke over pitocin induced labor contractions any day lol
Ftm here... I am getting the epidural!!  Dont think i can have my baby girl naturally!  Im so nervous already. Im 27 weeks 5 days almost there due oct. 30Th

I had an epidural with my first child. It was great but wore off toward the end. The doc said it was too late to get more because it was time to push. So I had great relief from contractions but felt ALL of the pushing down the birth canal. I feel like I can go without one this birth but I have preeclampsia and my blood pressure is already high. I know sometimes docs recommend epidurals to help when mom or baby's bp becomes elevated because of the stress and the pain. Its also good to have one in case of the need for an emergency c section it is already in place. Since I am high risk I know these are both possibilities so I may get one again just in case. I'm still debating, though I don't have long, I'm being induced at midnight. I may just go for so long and if I think I need it I'll ask for my doc to give it to me.

I had an epidural as soon as they said i could because they induced me the night before due to preeclampsia and the nurse had the monitor on my stomach wrong so she wasnt seeing my contractions and had the iv turned up way to high and they were back to back and it hurt! Finally she realized her mistake! But the epidual made it relaxing from then on and i was able to get some rest.
Just had my baby yesterday and got an epidural. For me it was amazing! I loved it! Completely Pain free but I felt everything when I was delivering. And my baby was almost 11 lbs. :)

I did all natural with my first daughter who is now 6.5, I don't believe in the epidural and it also scares the living crap out of me since there are life changing side effects that could happen. I'm now 34 weeks with my second daughter and still plan to go all natural. It makes for a faster delivery if you ask me plus shorter recovery time and time in the hospital. If there is any kind of emergency that happens I ask that I just be knocked out with anesthesia no epidural, epidurals also don't work sometimes like with my best friend. you do what you want and think is best for you and your baby :-)
I will not be getting an epidural and it will be will my 5th time going naturally. I know what to expect and know how to manage the pain so I don't need to get one.
I'm having my baby natural no section unless emergency. I'm deathly allergic to anesthesia so the thought of anything remotely close is always a definite No
Thanks ladies! I don't want an epidural only because I dont want my baby all drugged up and also the side effects... I hope I can stick with it!!

question: I still have a lot to go... but I want to know how many of you are planning to have your baby naturally or with the epidural shot. Or if you already had your baby, what was your plan?!
title: Epidural?
